text: Both the NLRP3 inflammasome activation and the subsequent inflammation play significant roles in defending against viral infections. However, aberrant NLRP3 inflammasome activation or chronic inflammation can also lead to severe pathological injury. Accordingly, activation of the NLRP3 inflammasome and its associated inflammation is a double-edged sword for host to defense viral infection. Modulating the NLRP3 inflammasome activity can prove to be a promising strategy for the intervention of viral diseases. In a juvenile mouse model of IAV infection, MCC950, a specific inhibitor of the NLRP3 inflammasome, ameliorates severe NLRP3 inflammasome-mediated lung injury without impairing viral clearance (76) .
